bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): policycoreutils-python-2.6-0.8.fc25.x86_64 policycoreutils-devel-2.6-0.8.fc25.x86_64 policycoreutils-python3-2.6-0.8.fc25.x86_64 policycoreutils-python-utils-2.6-0.8.fc25.x86_64 policycoreutils-gui-2.6-0.8.fc25.x86_64 policycoreutils-2.6-0.8.fc25.x86_64
How reproducible: * always
Actual results: # python Python 2.7.13 (default, Jan 12 2017, 17:59:37) [GCC 6.3.1 20161221 (Red Hat 6.3.1-1)] on linux2 Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information. >>> import sepolicy >>> sepolicy.search([sepolicy.DONTAUDIT]) [] >>> sepolicy.search([sepolicy.ALLOW]) Traceback (most recent call last): File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module> File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/sepolicy/__init__.py", line 326, in search tclass=tclass) File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/setools/terulequery.py", line 126, in __init__ super(TERuleQuery, self).__init__(policy, **kwargs) File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/setools/query.py", line 39, in __init__ setattr(self, name, kwargs[name]) File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/setools/descriptors.py", line 114, in __set__ self.instances[obj] = set(self.enum_class.lookup(v) for v in value) File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/setools/policyrep/util.py", line 53, in __hash__ return hash(self.name) AttributeError: 'TERuletype' object has no attribute 'name' >>> sepolicy.search([sepolicy.NEVERALLOW]) Traceback (most recent call last): File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module> File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/sepolicy/__init__.py", line 326, in search tclass=tclass) File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/setools/terulequery.py", line 126, in __init__ super(TERuleQuery, self).__init__(policy, **kwargs) File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/setools/query.py", line 39, in __init__ setattr(self, name, kwargs[name]) File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/setools/descriptors.py", line 114, in __set__ self.instances[obj] = set(self.enum_class.lookup(v) for v in value) File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/setools/policyrep/util.py", line 53, in __hash__ return hash(self.name) AttributeError: 'TERuletype' object has no attribute 'name' >>> sepolicy.search([sepolicy.ROLE_ALLOW]) Traceback (most recent call last): File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module> File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/sepolicy/__init__.py", line 352, in search tclass=tclass) File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/setools/rbacrulequery.py", line 88, in __init__ super(RBACRuleQuery, self).__init__(policy, **kwargs) File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/setools/query.py", line 39, in __init__ setattr(self, name, kwargs[name]) File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/setools/descriptors.py", line 114, in __set__ self.instances[obj] = set(self.enum_class.lookup(v) for v in value) File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/setools/policyrep/util.py", line 53, in __hash__ return hash(self.name) AttributeError: 'RBACRuletype' object has no attribute 'name' >>>
Expected results: * no tracebacks

# python Python 2.7.13 (default, Jan 12 2017, 17:59:37) [GCC 6.3.1 20161221 (Red Hat 6.3.1-1)] on linux2 Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information. >>> import sepolicy >>> sepolicy.search([sepolicy.TRANSITION]) Traceback (most recent call last): File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module> File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/sepolicy/__init__.py", line 339, in search tclass=tclass) File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/setools/terulequery.py", line 126, in __init__ super(TERuleQuery, self).__init__(policy, **kwargs) File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/setools/query.py", line 39, in __init__ setattr(self, name, kwargs[name]) File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/setools/descriptors.py", line 114, in __set__ self.instances[obj] = set(self.enum_class.lookup(v) for v in value) File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/setools/policyrep/util.py", line 53, in __hash__ return hash(self.name) AttributeError: 'TERuletype' object has no attribute 'name' >>> sepolicy.search([sepolicy.AUDITALLOW]) Traceback (most recent call last): File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module> File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/sepolicy/__init__.py", line 326, in search tclass=tclass) File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/setools/terulequery.py", line 126, in __init__ super(TERuleQuery, self).__init__(policy, **kwargs) File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/setools/query.py", line 39, in __init__ setattr(self, name, kwargs[name]) File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/setools/descriptors.py", line 114, in __set__ self.instances[obj] = set(self.enum_class.lookup(v) for v in value) File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/setools/policyrep/util.py", line 53, in __hash__ return hash(self.name) AttributeError: 'TERuletype' object has no attribute 'name' >>>

Thanks for the report. I'll try to to fix it.
However it seems to work with python3 - the Fedora default:
$ python3 Python 3.6.0 (default, Feb 2 2017, 10:42:33) [GCC 7.0.1 20170131 (Red Hat 7.0.1-0.4)] on linux Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information. >>> import sepolicy >>> allow = sepolicy.search([sepolicy.ALLOW]) >>> len(allow) 102025
This bug appears to have been reported against 'rawhide' during the Fedora 26 development cycle. Changing version to '26'.
